oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Discussion - Songwriter Session / Sharing the Art of Songwriting - James Dean Hicks - 2017-04-28
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Performance by James Dean Hicks and songwriting class for a Kentucky 8th grade school group from the Ford Theater at the Country Music Hall of Fame and Museum on April 28, 2017. Includes co-writing exercise with school group.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: James Dean Hicks;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Walk-in music / (00:20) Opening comments and introduction of James Dean Hicks / (01:02) Opening comments from James Dean Hicks / (05:03) Performs Grandpa Told Me So / (08:50) James talks to audience / (10:42) Performs Until You Got Love / (13:51) Hicks moves out in to the audience and works with them on writing a song / (18:49) James asks questions of them to come up with ideas for a song and guides them through the song writing process / (52:48) Performs self written song Day Tripping Nashville (group) / (54:50) Closing comments and encouragement by Hicks / (56:28) Recording end / (59:42) Walk-our music / (01:07:30) FILE END
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Hicks, James Dean
